symptoms.name: Rash
symptoms.pattern: Maculopapular eruption on trunk spreading to extremities, sparing palms and soles; petechiae in severe cases; onset 2-3 days after symptom onset

symptoms.name: Confusion
symptoms.severity: Variable, more common with severe disease or delayed treatment
symptoms.pattern: Can occur, indicative of neurological involvement

symptoms.name: Seizures
symptoms.severity: Variable, more common with severe disease or delayed treatment
symptoms.pattern: Can occur, indicative of neurological involvement

symptoms.name: Coma
symptoms.severity: Severe, more common with severe disease or delayed treatment
symptoms.pattern: Can occur, indicative of neurological involvement

risk_factors: Exposure to body lice (Pediculus humanus corporis)
Exposure to flying squirrels or their nests
War, famine, refugee camps, prisons, homelessness

required: History of body louse exposure or contact with flying squirrels/nests
supportive: Characteristic rash (but not reliable for diagnosis)
Positive serological tests (four-fold rise in antibody titer)
